qas.question: Who was the 1st Marquis of Pombal?

answers.text: Sebastião José de Carvalho e Melo

qas.question: What title did Archduchess Maria Anne Josefa hold?
Who arranged the widow de Melo's second marriage?
Who was de Melo's second marriage to?

answers.text: the daughter of the Austrian Field Marshal Leopold Josef, Count von Daun

qas.question: Who was not pleased by de Melo's second marriage?

context: In 1738, <a0_0>Sebastião José de Carvalho e Melo<a0_0/>, 1st Marquis of Pombal, began a diplomatic career as the Portuguese Ambassador in London and later in Vienna. The <a1_0><a2_0>Queen consort of Portugal<a2_0/><a1_0/>, Archduchess Maria Anne Josefa of Austria, was fond of Melo; and after his first wife died, she arranged the widowed de Melo's second marriage to <a3_0>the daughter of the Austrian Field Marshal Leopold Josef, Count von Daun<a3_0/>. <a4_0>King John V of Portugal<a4_0/>, however, was not pleased and recalled Melo to Portugal in 1749. John V died the following year and his son, Joseph I of Portugal, was crowned. In contrast to his father, Joseph I was fond of de Melo, and with the Queen Mother's approval, he appointed Melo as Minister of Foreign Affairs.
